intro: Pilosella plebeia, commonly known as the common pearly everlet, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in a cluster, with bracts that give it a pearly appearance. Pilosella plebeia typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, often forming dense mats. Its leaves are hairy and oval-shaped, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
